Company: Conopco Inc. dba Unilever Home and Personal Care
Description: CONOPCO, INC., doing business as UNILEVER HOME & PERSONAL CARE USA,  was sentenced by U.S. District Judge Robert N. Chatigny in Hartford to three years of probation and a $1 million fine for violating the Clean Water Act at its former manufacturing site in Clinton in 2008. As part of the resolution of this case, Unilever also is contributing $3.5 million to state and local environmental programs, and instituting a new environmental compliance program at its U.S. manufacturing facilities.
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/usao-ct/pr/unilever-pays-45-million-violating-clean-water-act-connecticut-facility
https://www.fmcsa.dot.gov/sites/fmcsa.dot.gov/files/docs/closedByEnforcement_FY2015_06-19-2015.xlsx

Private Litigation Case Title: Sanderson et al v. Conopco, Inc.

Description: Conopco agreed to spend $3.5 million on environmental projects as part of the settlement of allegations the company violated the Clean Water Act at its former manufacturing site in Clinton in 2008. This was part of a larger $4.5 million settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/ct-conopco-inc-dba-unilever-home-and-person
